WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Fixed in SVN

As a bonus, there is a great improvement in performance when writing images using PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5.

Try a plain file conversion (read/write) of an xlsx file to xls of a workbook containing one JPEG digital photo 3008x2000 pixels.

On a shared web hosting account, the results were:

Using PHPExcel 1.6.5:
----
Execution time: 4min 8sec
Peak memory usage: 92 MB 
Generated xls filesize: 17.8 MB

Using current source from SVN:
----
Execution time: 0.77 sec
Peak memory usage: 15.5 MB 
Generated xls filesize: 0.685 MB ~ approx. size of input


Notes:

* PHPExcel_Reader_Excel5 is still slow for reading images. If you want to create xls files from template using images, use an xlsx template

* Avoid using GIF images if you can with PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5, there is no native support for GIF in Excel 5.0 ~ 2003, therefore PHPExcel will have to convert to PNG which is expensive.

* Attaching the new 14excel5.xls for reference.
WorkItem.Description:
When one creates an xls file using PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5, then the images do not show when one opens the file in OpenOffice. Try with attached sample file.
 
This is probably because the images are stored using the (old?) IMDATA record (0x007F) and not the MSODRAWING record (0x00EC). OpenOffice does not seem to recognize the IMDATA record.
 
It would be better if PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5 stored images using the MSODRAWING record not only for the above reason, but file sizes can also become quite large since IMDATA stores bitmap as uncompressed (I think).
 
At the moment I am not sure what it takes to solve this. Reference for MS-ODRAW:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc441433.aspx
WorkItem.Summary: Images not showing in OpenOffice when using PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5

Comments.Message:
This has also been reported for the PEAR Spreadsheet_Excel_Writer which PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5 is based on.
http://pear.php.net/bugs/bug.php?id=6909

This will maybe be fixed in OpenOffice.org 3.1
http://www.openoffice.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=11734

But even if OpenOffice 3.1 does show the images, this work item still need to be dealt with. File size of the xls file generated by PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5 is still way too big because it stores images as uncompressed bitmaps.

reference: http://www.codeplex.com/PHPExcel/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=43553

using SVN i've an error:

15:11:01 Create new PHPExcel object 15:11:01 Load Excel2007 template file
Fatal error: Class 'PHPExcel_Shared_Excel5' not found in /var/www/test/PHPExcel-24480/Classes/PHPExcel/Reader/Excel5.php on line 694
@mmiat: thank you for the notice, this has now also been fixed. Next check-in everything will be ok !

i have the same problem with open office : image doesn't show with  Excel5.
i test with many examples but nothing.

there is no solution yet?

thanks for your help.

@mkelefa: What version of PHPExcel are you using? (PHPExcel 1.6.5 will not work). Please try with latest source from here:
http://www.codeplex.com/PHPExcel/SourceControl/ListDownloadableCommits.aspx
